Detailed Description

A common list of font values.

Member Function Documentation

virtual TItem* TFontList::setItem ( const QVariant &  _value,
const QString &  _text = QString::null,
QIcon *  _icon = 0 
) [virtual]

Constructs and adds a new TItem to the list.

Parameters:
_value value of the item.
_text text of the item (will be shown in drop-down list).
_icon item icon.
Returns:
newly created TItem.

Reimplemented from TItemList.

virtual bool TFontList::paintComboItem ( QPainter *  painter,
QStyleOptionViewItem &  option,
const QModelIndex &  index,
QVariant &  data 
) [virtual]

Paints combo box item at index. Reimplement this if you want to make custom drawing in the drop down combo. Return true if you wish to call QItemDelegate::paint() method at the end (i.e. only painting options are changed), or false if painting is fully custom. data is the value of item, option is font/palette options to change, painter is the active painter.

Since:
3.2

Reimplemented from TItemList.

virtual bool TFontList::compareComboItem ( const QVariant &  list_value,
const QVariant &  item_value 
) [virtual]

Returns true if list_value equals item_value. Reimplement this if you want to make custom search of list item in the drop down combo.

Since:
3.2

Reimplemented from TItemList.

virtual void TFontList::highlightComboItem ( QVariant &  data,
int  index,
QComboBox *  box,
QPoint  hintPos 
) [virtual]

Performs visual actions when an item is highlighted in combo box. Reimplement this if you want to make, say, custom tooltips. data is the value of highlighted item, index is the index of data, box is the combo box, hintPos is the preferred position for item hint (under the combo if item was changed in closed combo, or right to item if it was changed in open combo).

Since:
3.2

Reimplemented from TItemList.

virtual QSize TFontList::sizeHintComboItem ( QVariant &  data,
const QStyleOptionViewItem &  option 
) const [virtual]

Returns size hint for the current combo item. Reimplement this if you want to provide custom heights of combo items. data is the value of item, option is font/palette options.

Since:
3.2

Reimplemented from TItemList.

Searches for TItem with value _value. Returns 0 if not found.

virtual TItem* TItemList::findItemByText ( const QString &  _text  )  [virtual, inherited]

Searches for TItem with text _text. Returns 0 if not found.

See also:
findItem()

TItemList& TItemList::operator<< ( const QString &  _text  )  [inherited]

Helper operator to quickly fill lists consisting of simple text items with corresponding values of 0,1,2,3. For example:

        TItemList *listTenzType = new TItemList;

        *listTenzType << "Absent" << "Manual" << "Automatic";   // "Absent" will get the value of 0, "Manual" of 1, "Automatic" of 2

TItemList& TItemList::operator<< ( double  _val  )  [inherited]

Helper operator to quickly fill lists consisting of simple doubles with corresponding values. For example:

        TItemList *listSize = new TItemList;

        *listSize << 1 << 2 << 2.5 << 3 << 3.2 << 3.5 << 3.8;

TItemList& TItemList::operator<< ( const ITEM &  _pair  )  [inherited]

Helper operator to quickly fill lists consisting of simple text items with corresponding values. For example:

        TItemList *listTenzType = new TItemList;

        *listTenzType << ITEM("Manual", 10) << ITEM("Automatic", 12);   // "Manual" will get the value of 10, "Automatic" of 12

TItemList& TItemList::operator<< ( const QList< int > &  _intList  )  [inherited]

Helper operator to to fill with list of integers with corresponding values. For example:

        TItemList fontSizeList;
        fontSizeList = QFontDatabase::standardSizes();  // fontSizeList will be filled with standard font sizes.

Since:
3.2

TItemList& TItemList::operator<< ( const QList< double > &  _doubleList  )  [inherited]

Helper operator to fill with list of doubles with corresponding values.

Since:
3.2

TItemList& TItemList::operator<< ( const QStringList &  _stringList  )  [inherited]

Helper operator to fill with string list with corresponding values. For example:

        TItemList fontNamesList;
        fontNamesList = QFontDatabase::families();  // fontNamesList will be filled with the names of available font families.

Since:
3.2
